title.narrative: Pakistan: Balochistan Education Support Project - BESP

description.narrative: The development objective of the project is to promote public-private and community partnerships to improve access to quality primary education, in particular for girls

condition.narrative: The Govt. of Balochistan shall provide recurrent expenditures for community schools (including teacher salaries) through BEF fromthe third year of each school's operations.
The Project Implementing Entity shall: (i) vest responsibility for the overall management and coordination of the Project inBEF; and
to that end, ensure that BEF will be maintained, with functions, staffing and resources satisfactory to the Association.

title.narrative: An additional 35,000 students in primary schools established through community and public-private partnerships, by end of project period.

comment.narrative: 752,000 primary school students (707,000 in govt schools and 45,000 in private/non-Govt. schools)- Source: GER from PSLMS (CWIQ)Survey 2004-05and Pop. Estim. from NIPS- PAD Annex 1
Number of students in projects supported schools

26,248 students in Community Schools in rural areas (gross enrollment); BEF is no longer collecting data from private schoolswith which it has completed its contract.Please note that there is a lag of 3 months between data collection and reporting.
752,000 primary school students (707,000 in govt schools and 45,000 in private/non-Govt. schools)- Source: GER from PSLMS (CWIQ)Survey 2004-05and Pop. Estim. from NIPS- PAD Annex 1
Students enrolled in BESP supported community schools in remote rural areas; gross enrollment. Please note that there is a lag of3months between data collection and reporting.

title.narrative: Average annual teacher attendance rate (net of leave entitlement) in project schools.

comment.narrative: Baseline is average annual attendance rate for first year of school operation. First schools under project were opened in March/April 2007.

target.value: Average teacher attendance rate in project schools > 90%

comment.narrative: Community school data only. Please note that there is a lag of 3 months between data collection and reporting.

title.narrative: Average Student attendance rate in project schools

baseline.value: 84% in community schools91% in private schools

comment.narrative: Baseline is average attendance in first year of school operation. First schools under project opened in March/April 2007.
Community school data only. Please note that there is a lag of 3 months between data collection and reporting.

title.narrative: Average Student grade completion rate in project schools

comment.narrative: Baseline is average grade completion of first year of school operation. First schools under project were opened in March/April 2007.
Community school data only. Please note that there is a lag of 3 months between data collection and reporting.

title.narrative: At least 40% enrolment in community schools is of girls in project schools. (Aimed at decreasing the the gender disparity in primary education in Balochistan in pursuance of the MDG Goals )

baseline.value: Not Measured as First schools under project opened in March 2007.

comment.narrative: PSLM 2004-05 Data Pakistan primary GER: M/F (94/77) Balochistan primary GER: M/F (83/49)

target.value: At least 40% enrolment in community schools is of girls. The project is too small to impact Pakistan level GERs or genderdisparity. End of project Balochistan GER target (87/55)

comment.narrative: Community school data only. Please note that there is a lag of 3 months between data collection and reporting.
No new training in current FY.
Number of teachers trained to date. No new training this FY.

title.narrative: Average annual increase in Learning Achievement in Language and Mathematics in project schools

baseline.value: No data available for Katchi (Kindergarden) and Grade 1.

target.value: An annual increase of 3% and 5% respectively in Langauge and Mathematics.

actual.value: 5% of children in grade 2 and 6% in grade 5 can

comment.narrative: EGRA and EGMA tools were used in the last round to assess student learning.
An additional 29 schools are in the final stage of completion and will be completed by July 30; 5 schools were dropped because ofcommunity conflict on land.

title.narrative: System for learning assessment at the primary level

comment.narrative: Balochistan conducts provincial level diagnostic assessments (based on a district representative sample). Although system exists,assessments not conducted annually.

title.narrative: Utility of the learning assessment system
